conversion_verification.notes: Second image shows extruded walls with thickness, visible side faces, and a cutaway (no roof/ceiling). View is slightly angled but close to top-down.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear wall height/thickness and readable room volumes. View is only mildly isometric (near top-down), reducing depth cues. Cutaway is clean with mostly continuous wall geometry.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room layout matches well (living/dining central, kitchen bottom-center, bedrooms on left/top/right, toilets clustered similarly, deck at top). Some proportional/partition simplifications and minor deviations in opening placement/extent.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture present (beds, sofa, dining table), kitchen counters/appliances represented, and bathroom fixtures visible. A few elements appear simplified/blocky but room assignment is largely correct.

visual_clarity.notes: Walls/floors/openings are distinguishable and the model is readable. Lighting is adequate with minimal artifacts; some areas are slightly flat due to the near-orthographic camera.

detected_errors.description: Several doors/windows/opening widths and placements appear simplified and may not precisely match the 2D plan (some openings look resized or shifted).
Minor proportional differences in a few internal partitions/room extents (overall adjacency correct, but some wall runs and room depths look slightly altered compared to the 2D plan).

summary: A true 3D cutaway is produced with largely faithful room layout and furnishings, but the camera is near top-down and some openings/partition proportions deviate from the 2D plan.
